detaileddescription.para: By convention we always define this_type in AbcGeom classes. Used by unspecified-bool-type conversion below
The default constructor creates an empty ISubDSchema ...

memberdef.argsstring: (CPROP_PTR iParent, const std::string &iName, const Abc::Argument &iArg0=Abc::Argument(), const Abc::Argument &iArg1=Abc::Argument())
memberdef.name: ISubDSchema

detaileddescription.para: This templated, primary constructor creates a new subd reader. The first argument is any Abc (or AbcCoreAbstract) object which can intrusively be converted to an CompoundPropertyWriterPtr to use as a parent, from which the error handler policy for inheritance is also derived. The remaining optional arguments can be used to override the ErrorHandlerPolicy and to specify schema interpretation matching.
Same constructor as above, but use the default schema name, ie, ".geom".
